description: a(n) = F(n+3) + c(n) where F(k) is k-th Fibonacci number and c(n) is n-th number that is 1 or 2 or is not a Fibonacci number.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: With[{nn=40},fibs=Fibonacci[Range[nn]];nonf=Take[Join[{1,2}, Complement[Range[nn+Length[fibs]],fibs]], Length[fibs]-3]; Total/@Thread[{Drop[fibs,3],nonf}]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 30 2011 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
